Mentoring makes all the difference for many young people. Thanks for all the work you do in our region! https://twitter.com/MPSWPA/status/1090658864024948736 …

The Social Security 2100 Act would allow for a modest benefit increase across the board, a more accurate cost of living formula, and a new special minimum benefit. It is commonsense, and it will help countless Americans to make ends meet. #SECURE2100

Social Security guarantees financial security for seniors, widows, and Americans with disabilities. These are earned benefits that must be preserved for generations to come - and I am joining @RepJohnLarson on the Social Security 2100 Act to do just that. #SECURE2100 pic.twitter.com/V5ekPW84px

There are going to be dangerously cold temperatures in #PGH this week. For more information about warming centers throughout the city, click ➡️ https://www.wtae.com/article/list-of-warming-centers-open-in-pittsburgh-area/25972426 …

Ten years after President Obama signed the Lilly Ledbetter #FairPay Act, women are still battling the wage gap. I am a cosponsor of the #PaycheckFairness Act to end harmful patterns of pay discrimination.

Today is Holocaust Remembrance Day, the anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz - and #WeRemember the six million victims of Nazism. We must ensure these atrocities are never forgotten and take seriously our responsibility to eradicate racism, hatred, and oppression. pic.twitter.com/S9Uq4B1gGd

Grateful to our federal employees who worked without pay throughout the #TrumpShutdown. Policy differences shouldn't be a reason to shut the government down - and this should never happen again. Now let's get back to our important work on behalf of the American people.

I voted to #EndTheShutdown for the 10th time and to reopen the federal government and guarantee back pay to federal employees during shutdown. I urge the Senate to pass this legislation. pic.twitter.com/wrbNTCLT2j
Congratulations, Kazeem! Best of luck as you continue your studies. https://twitter.com/ODLEmgmt/status/1088073620491063297 …

Senator Harris Wofford was dedicated to public service throughout his life. His commitment to making this country a better place showed in all he did. Remembering his remarkable life today and sending my thoughts to his family. https://www.wtae.com/article/former-pa-sen-harris-wofford-dies-at-age-92/25989302 …
On this #MLKDay, we honor a true leader. May his legacy and Dream continue to inspire us as we fight inequality, injustice, and intolerance in all their forms today. pic.twitter.com/d3jsUzMH7P

PGH TSA workers are on the job protecting the public, but not getting paid. It’s a disgrace that @POTUS shut down the govt over wall $. @POTUS should reopen the govt immediately, #EndTheShutdown and negotiate with Congress about border security issues. https://twitter.com/PaAFL_CIO/status/1086295240623964168 …

Pleased to see some local help for federal employees who aren’t getting paid during the #TrumpShutdown. But the best way to help them is for @realDonaldTrump and Mitch McConnell to #EndTheShutdown! https://www.wesa.fm/post/some-utilities-banks-extending-financial-help-government-employees-during-shutdown …

The federal minimum wage hasn’t been raised in 10 years. I am a cosponsor of the #RaiseTheWage Act which would gradually raise the minimum wage to $15 by 2024. A living wage for all workers helps business, families, and the economy! pic.twitter.com/tif8HKTB2z

@EnergyCommerce Dems elected me as Chair of the Subcommittee on Communications and Technology. I’m excited for the opportunity to set the Committee’s agenda on issues like #NetNeutrality that benefit consumers, small businesses, and innovators – and conduct oversight of the @FCC. https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1085283773644763138 …

Today, I voted in support of H.J.Res. 27 to reopen government agencies through February 28. This gives President Trump and Republicans another option for reopening the government while we negotiate over border security. #EndTheShutdown pic.twitter.com/VM8RDqahai

#TrumpShutdown isn’t a minor inconvenience for federal workers like prison guards; it could cost them their jobs, which require periodic background checks. Bad credit records for late bills or missing mortgage payments could force them out. https://www.post-gazette.com/news/politics-nation/2019/01/11/shutdown-Loretto-federal-prison-paycheck-Union-trump-border-wall/stories/201901100184 …

25 days into the #TrumpShutdown, many people in #PGH are wondering how they will make ends meet on housing and groceries. @HouseDemocrats have voted many times to re-open the government and it is time to #EndTheShutdown. https://www.post-gazette.com/news/politics-nation/2019/01/11/Government-shutdown-HUD-housing-Riverview-Towers/stories/201901110104 …

This is Day 25 of the #TrumpShutdown and our public lands are suffering. Rather than investing in future projects, @NatlParkService is using $ from visitor fees to clean up the shutdown's mess. We need to protect these national treasures for the future and #EndTheShutdown. pic.twitter.com/e8twFlqdVS

Oceans are warming 40% faster than recent estimates, and temperatures continue to break records every year. The devastating effects of #ClimateChange are here and we’d better address them NOW! https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/10/climate/ocean-warming-climate-change.html …

Voted in favor of H.R. 266 to fund Interior and EPA. This will reopen and protect our National Parks, allow critical environmental inspections and technical assistance to resume, and fund #NEH and #NEA. One step closer to #EndTheShutdown! pic.twitter.com/pNZfV5Xiy2

Federal employees are missing a paycheck today - 11,471 federal workers in PA are in agencies impacted by the #TrumpShutdown. It is completely unacceptable to prevent public servants from doing their jobs and earning a living. #EndTheShutdown and get them back to work! pic.twitter.com/O4PXa9BZ5z

The #TrumpShutdown is leaving our National Parks unprotected and understaffed. These national treasures should be preserved for all Americans to enjoy, not exposed to vandalism and overflowing waste. #EndTheShutdown https://www.post-gazette.com/news/nation/2019/01/01/In-shutdown-national-parks-transformed-into-Wild-West-heavily-populated-and-barely-supervised/stories/201901010727 …

Throughout the #TrumpShutdown, the @EPA has been forced to halt inspections of drinking water systems, hazardous waste management, and chemical facilities. Keeping our water and air clean is essential - we must #EndTheShutdown. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/09/climate/epa-pollution-inspection-shutdown.html …

I voted to pass H.R. 267 to fund the Department of Transportation and Housing and Urban Development. This bill would protect the safety of air and highway transportation and ensure that Americans living in public housing are not evicted in the #TrumpShutdown. pic.twitter.com/bygdRV11I0

House Democrats passed H.R. 265 to fund the Department of Agriculture and the Food & Drug Administration. This bill would get food safety inspectors back to work and it'd fund SNAP, eliminating uncertainty for families who rely on the food assistance it provides. #EndTheShutdown

Joined the @PghCurrent this morning to talk about the #TrumpShutdown and my priorities for the 116th Congress – including #NetNeutrality. Tune in ➡️ https://sorgatronmedia.com/pittsburgh-current-podcast-u-s-representative-mike-doyle/ …

Due to the #TrumpShutdown, @US_FDA has suspended routine inspections of food-processing facilities. This puts our food supply and public health at risk with no end in sight. #EndTheShutdown https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/424562-fda-says-most-food-inspections-have-been-halted-amid-shutdown …

I voted in support of H.R. 264, a bill to fund the operations of key agencies like the Treasury, IRS, Small Business Administration, Federal Trade Commission, and Securities and Exchange Commission. This was an important first step to reopening the government. #EndTheShutdown! pic.twitter.com/JTT7TJk4RD

House Democrats just passed a resolution to protect the Affordable Care Act and allow Congress to intervene in the lawsuit trying to strike down affordable health coverage. Americans with pre-existing conditions need the #ACA and I am working to #ProtectOurCare! pic.twitter.com/xZ8oG4nkO8

The government now enters the 19th day of a partial shutdown - this includes the White House’s drug policy shop, ONDCP, which coordinates all government opioid efforts. #EndTheShutdown

Our immigration system is broken and ought to be fixed - and I certainly support smart, effective improvements in our nation’s border security - but the shutdown should end now so we can move ahead with finding common ground. I’m pleased @GovernorTomWolf is moving to address #ClimateChange but we also need action from the federal government, in addition to states and municipalities. Due to the #TrumpShutdown, the Small Business Administration cannot operate its core lending and investment programs. This hurts small business and the consumers that rely on their products and services - and our economy! #EndTheShutdown

I joined @RepAustinDavis, @SenatorCosta, @GovernorTomWolf, and @ACE_Fitzgerald today to discuss important local workforce development issues. Representatives weren't technically allowed to make changes like that until we were officially sworn in yesterday afternoon as Members of the #116thCongress, but the number has since been updated. Thanks for the reminder!

Today, I joined @HouseDemocrats in passing legislation to stop the #TrumpShutdown. It has been 12 days, and we have a responsibility to the American people to reopen the government. @POTUS should join us in getting to work on comprehensive bipartisan immigration reform! pic.twitter.com/gf61AT7ioR

Just sworn in as a member of the 116th Congress, and looking forward to a fresh start with a Democratic Majority in the House. First order of business should be ending the #TrumpShutdown and getting the whole government running again - and we will vote to do that later today.
